div.l: This Millere goth a geyn no word he seide
But doth his note and wiþ his clerkes pleide
Til þate hire corne was faire ⁊and wel I groıı̄unde
And whan the Mele is sakked and I boıı̄unde
This Iohn Goth out ⁊and fynt his hors a way
And gan to crie harrow and weilaway
Oure hors is lost Alayn for goddes banes
Steppe on thi feet come of man all attanes
Allas oure wardeyn has his palfray lorn
This Aleyn al forgat bothe mele ⁊and corn
All was out of his mynde his housbondrie
What whilke wey is he gon he gan to crye
The wyf cam lepyng inward at aren
Sche seide allas ȝoure hors goth to þe fen
Wiþ wylde mares as faste as he may goo
Vnþank come on his hond þat bonde him so
And he þat bettre schulde haue knet þe reyne
¶ Allas quod Iohn Alayn for cristes peyne
Ley doıı̄un thi swerd and I wil myn alswa
I is ful swift god wate as is a Ra
By goddes herte he schal noght scape vs bathe
Whi ne hadde þou putte þe caple in the lathe
Il haile by god þou is a fonne
This sely clerkes han ful faste I ronne
Toward the fen bothe Aleyn ⁊and eke Iohn
And when the Millere seigh þat þei were gon
He half a busshel of here flour haþ take
And bad his wyf go knede hit in a kake
And seide I trowe þe clerkes weren aferd
Ȝit can a Millere make a clerkes berd
For all his art ȝit lete hem gon her wey
Lo where he goth ȝe late þe children pley
Thei gete him noght so lightly be my crowne
Thise sely clerkes rennen vp ⁊and downe
With kepe · kepe · stand · stand iossa warderere
Ga whistel þou and I sall kepe him here
But schortly til it was v̉erray nyght
Thei kouthe not þogh þei dede all her myght Correcting collations.
